feed.name: Speculative Technologies, Materials & Manufacturing: unlocking innovations underpinning civilization
feed.description: From the Bronze Age to Silicon Valley, civilizations are defined by the materials they can create and make into useful things. But in the 21st century this powerful engine of progress needs maintenance. This talk will unpack the futures that new materials and manufacturing processes could unlock, why they so often fall into the ‚Äúvalley of death‚Äù between invention and impact, and what we can do to bridge that gap. Recorded at the 2024 Progress Conference in Berkeley, CA, by @freethink, a sponsor of the event.

feed.name: Howard Roark Speech - The Fountainhead ----- (My favorite F you speech of all time)
Building Data Centers in Iceland: The Land of Fire and Ice - JSA
How to apply the artistry of Death Stranding to creating as an auteur
feed.description: Hideo Kojima created a true masterpiece. Find out what practices helped this amazing game come together. üõ° A mission to cure loneliness in society ‚ôü Resolute decisionmaking, not just doing the popular thing üí• Action: knowing what to delegate, outsource, and do yourself üé≠ Showmanship that sets the tone These things taken together allow teams to create something that has never existed before. Death Stranding is no exception. Here's the full transcript if you prefer to read: https://blog.garrytan.com/the-4-habits-of-auteurs-that-made-hideo-kojimas-video-game-masterpiece-death-stranding I'm Garry Tan, venture capitalist and cofounder at Initialized Capital. We were earliest investors in billion dollar startups like Coinbase and Instacart, and we're spending time with some of our best founders to learn the secrets of their success and see the future they're building. I'm doing my own run-and-gun one man YouTube channel with no staff or crew - we're going for raw and unfiltered, not perfect. Please like this video...

feed.name: Stephen Kotkin ‚Äî How Stalin Became the Most Powerful Dictator in History
feed.description: Stephen Kotkin is arguably the world‚Äôs foremost expert on Joseph Stalin and has written a massive 2-volume biography about him (with a 3rd volume in the works). No other individual had more of a profound impact on the 20th century than Stalin. He held the power of life and death over every single person across 11 time zones, and he killed tens of millions of people, utterly consumed by an ideology aimed at building paradise on Earth. And he was one half of the biggest and most consequential military confrontation in history (even if Hitler didn‚Äôt prove to be his match). Read the transcript: https://www.dwarkesh.com/p/stephen-kotkin Apple Podcasts: https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/dwarkesh-podcast/id1516093381?i=1000716709877 Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/episode/0Wb7GWB1DmmO8Jw3ILPavW?si=2bcf0bfa96b442ba ---------------------------------------- SPONSORS * Lighthouse is THE fastest immigration solution for the technology industry. content.truncatedHtml: New tools for AI assisted literature analysis through efforts like those at Future House and the release of OpenAI‚Äôs Deep Research means that the marginal cost of a landscape analysis of existing literature is going down fast, but nothing beats candid conversations with the people behind the work.

feed.name: Covering Chernobyl - The Impossible Task
feed.description: This video tells the story of containing the exposed reactor 4‚Äôs core, by building the original Chernobyl Sarcophagus. An emergency shelter built in extreme conditions, using dangerous methods, and with little room for error. I‚Äôve spent hours reconstructing the project using archival photos, forgotten blueprints, and never-before-seen animations. This is the story of one of the most complex and dangerous construction projects ever attempted. Creative Commons Attribution, sources and map files: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1uNZbZON4orca4QPDW_XLq2_BDhy5-u677_GExV4NK8E/edit?tab=t.0 All music and sound effects are from Artlist.
